intro: Pichisermollia tibetana, commonly known as the Tibetan pichisermollia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
